questions.question: What is the primary purpose of statistical databases?

answers.a: To allow direct access to individual records
answers.b: To provide summarized information using aggregate queries
answers.d: To prevent all types of database queries

explanations.a: Statistical databases do not allow direct access to individual records.
explanations.b: Statistical databases return summarized results such as COUNT, SUM, and AVERAGE to protect individual privacy.
explanations.c: Encryption is a separate security mechanism and not the primary purpose here.
explanations.d: Statistical databases allow queries but in an aggregated form.

questions.question: What type of attack exploits aggregate query results to infer private information?

explanations.a: Brute-force attacks target passwords, not statistical queries.
explanations.b: SQL injection exploits query syntax vulnerabilities.
explanations.c: Inference attacks deduce sensitive information from aggregate query outputs.
explanations.d: Denial of service attacks aim to disrupt availability, not infer data.

questions.question: What is a differencing attack in statistical databases?

answers.a: Running the same query multiple times to overload the system
answers.b: Comparing results of slightly different aggregate queries to infer individual data
answers.d: Encrypting query results before returning them

explanations.a: This relates to performance issues, not inference.
explanations.b: Differencing attacks compare closely related aggregate query results to infer private information.
explanations.c: Attackers do not directly modify data in differencing attacks.
explanations.d: Encryption does not define a differencing attack.

questions.question: How does noise addition help prevent inference attacks?

answers.c: By adding controlled random values to query outputs

explanations.a: Noise addition does not block queries entirely.
explanations.b: Encryption is not the mechanism used in noise addition.
explanations.c: Noise addition adds small random values so attackers cannot obtain exact results.
explanations.d: Database size does not affect inference attacks directly.

questions.question: What is the main role of k-anonymity (query-set-size control)?

answers.a: To ensure each query returns exactly k results
answers.b: To allow queries only when the result set size is at least k
answers.c: To encrypt k records in the database
answers.d: To limit the number of users accessing the database

explanations.a: The result size does not have to be exactly k.
explanations.b: k-anonymity blocks or suppresses results when the query set size is smaller than k.
explanations.d: This is related to access control, not k-anonymity.

questions.question: Why is rate limiting effective against inference attacks?

answers.c: It restricts repeated or rapid execution of queries
answers.d: It allows unlimited access to aggregate queries

explanations.a: Rate limiting does not affect speed.
explanations.b: Rate limiting does not encrypt data.
explanations.c: Inference attacks rely on repeated queries, which rate limiting prevents.
explanations.d: Unlimited access would increase inference risk.
